intro: Benkara depauperata, commonly known as the sparse benkara, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, pale pink flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in dense undergrowth of tropical forests. Its blooming period is brief, typically occurring during the late spring to early summer months. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Benkara depauperata is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
